title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) — On a night when offense was a precious commodity, the Los Angeles Clippers rode one of the most dominant individual performances in league history to a grinding road victory.

In a 93-84 win over the San Antonio Spurs, Clippers forward Loy Vaught didn’t just score; he orchestrated a one-man symphony of efficiency and power against the stunned hosts. Vaught erupted for a career-high and game-high 41 points, a staggering figure in a contest where neither team could crack 95 points. He was virtually unguardable, converting 18 of his 24 field goal attempts and pulling down 15 rebounds to complete a Herculean double-double.

While Vaught was putting on a historic clinic, the Spurs scrambled for answers. David Robinson led San Antonio with 24 points and 13 rebounds, and Sean Elliott added 19 points, but their efforts were drowned out by the relentless tide of Vaught’s performance. The Spurs’ offense never found a consistent rhythm, shooting just 40.5% from the field as a team.

The Clippers, feeding off their superstar’s energy, methodically built their lead. With Vaught scoring at will in the paint and cleaning the glass at both ends, Los Angeles controlled the tempo and secured a crucial, hard-fought road win. His 41 points were not just a personal triumph but the undeniable engine of the Clippers' victory, a singular force that the Spurs simply had no answer for on this night. It was a performance for the ages, carved out in the grit of a defensive battle.
